result.execSummary:
The defendant Aron M Leber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Commitment Order being entered for failure to pay fine/forfeiture amount, and if penalty time is served, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant for the remaining forfeiture/fine amount.  If defendant files proof of indigency with the court and it is approved by the court, the commitment shall then be converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aron M Leber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
